extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grammar

        public Grammar(java.io.File GrammarFile)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructor constructs a Grammar object from a file. The file must be readable and writable.
        Parameters:
        GrammarFile - the grammar file to use
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the grammar file can't be found this exception will be thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • addRule

        public final void addRule(java.lang.String grammarRule)
                   throws GrammarFileLoadException
        Adds a new grammar rule to a file, using a string. The string is formatted using the taglang syntax.
        Parameters:
        grammarRule - a string description of a grammar rule.
        Throws:
        GrammarFileLoadException - if grammar file can't be read or written

      • addRule

        public final void addRule(Tag[][] grammarRule)
                   throws GrammarFileLoadException
        Adds a new grammar rule to a file, using an array of array of Tags(a "matrix" of tags.
        A grammar rule in taglang is simply a 2D array of tags. It is the task of the parser to determine how to interpret this array.
        Parameters:
        grammarRule - 2D array of tags that is interpreted by a parser.
        Throws:
        GrammarFileLoadException - if grammar file can't be read or written

      • removeRule

        public final void removeRule(int index)
        Removes a grammar rule from a file, by specifying the index.
        Parameters:
        index -

      • setGrammarFile

        public final void setGrammarFile(java.io.File GrammarFile)
                          throws GrammarFileLoadException
        A Grammar object requires a grammar file. The grammar file stores the tags needed to describe the grammar for use by the parser. The grammar class can work without a file, in this case it simply has no grammatical rules.
        Parameters:
        GrammarFile - the grammar file to be used
        Throws:
        GrammarFileLoadException - if the grammar file can be read or written to.

      • ruleCount

        public final int ruleCount()
                    throws GrammarFileLoadException
        The number of grammar rules associated with the grammar object
        Returns:
        the number of grammar rules
        Throws:
        GrammarFileLoadException - if grammar file can't be read or written to.

      • ruleAt

        public final java.lang.String ruleAt(int index)
                              throws GrammarFileLoadException
        Finds the particular rule at the specified index and returns a string value representing the rule. If a rule is not found at the specified index an empty string is returned.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the rule
        Returns:
        A string representing the the grammar rule.
        Throws:
        GrammarFileLoadException

      • validateSyntax

        public static final boolean validateSyntax(java.lang.String grammarRule)
        Validates a string to see whether or not it follows valid taglang syntax. Tag texts can only contain letters A-z a-z, numbers 0-9 or underscore(_); The valid tag type identifiers are:
        $ - Default tag
        + - Prefix tag
        - - Suffix tag
        . - Infix tag
        Comments start with //
        Parameters:
        grammarRule -
        Returns:
        true if the syntax is valid, false otherwise.
